summary: england coach john peacock has named his squad for next month 's uefa european under-17 championship in bulgaria . the young lions are the defending champions , having beaten holland on penalties in the final last year , and progressed to this edition with a 100 per cent record in qualifying . they have been placed in group d alongside holland , italy and the republic of ireland this time around and will open their campaign against italy in burgas on may 7 .

aspect: 1. England's Under-17 squad for the UEFA European Championship is announced by coach John Peacock, who included talented young players from various Premier League clubs.
2. The Young Lions aim to defend their title, having won last year against Holland on penalties.
3. The squad features players from clubs like Chelsea, Arsenal, Liverpool, and Everton, with some notable first-time call-ups such as Arsenal's Chris Willock.
explain: John Peacock, England's Under-17 coach, announced the squad for the UEFA European Championship, featuring talented young players from different Premier League clubs. As defending champions, the team aims to secure another victorious performance in the tournament.

The Young Lions aim to successfully defend their championship title they won last year against Holland in the final, with the team looking forward to their upcoming matches in the UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria.
